devdoc.author: Jake Nyquist - j@hook.xyz
devdoc.details: This contract implements ERC721Receiver This contract views the tokenId for the asset on the ERC721 contract as the corresponding assetId for that asset when deposited into the vault

assetTokenId(uint32).details: returns the underlying token ID for a given asset. In this case the tokenId == the assetId

clearEntitlement(uint32).details: See {IHookERC721Vault-clearEntitlement}.This can only be called if an entitlement currently exists, otherwise it would be a no-op

clearEntitlementAndDistribute(uint32,add.details: See {IHookERC721Vault-clearEntitlementAndDistribute}.The entitlement must be exist, and must be called by the {operator}. The operator can specify a intended receiver, which should match the beneficialOwner. The function will throw if the receiver and owner do not match.

params.assetId: the id of the specific vaulted asset
params.receiver: the intended receiver of the asset

params.assetId: the id of the underlying asset

grantEntitlement((address,address,addres.details: See {IHookERC721Vault-grantEntitlement}.The entitlement must be sent by the current beneficial owner

imposeEntitlement(address,uint32,uint32,.details: See {IHookERC721Vault-imposeEntitlement}.The entitlement must be signed by the current beneficial owner of the contract. Anyone can submit the entitlement

setBeneficialOwner(uint32,address).details: See {IHookERC721Vault-setBeneficialOwner}. setBeneficialOwner can only be called by the entitlementContract if there is an activeEntitlement.

validateEntitlementSignature(address,uin.details: Validates that a specific signature is actually the entitlement EIP-712 signed by the beneficial owner specified in the entitlement.

withdrawalAsset(uint32).details: See {IHookERC721Vault-withdrawalAsset}.withdrawals can only be performed to the beneficial owner if there are no entitlements

_nftContract.details: these are the NFT contract address and tokenId the vault is covering

assets.details: the current entitlement applied to each asset, which includes the beneficialOwner for the asset if the entitled operator field is non-null, it means an unreleased entitlement has been applied; however, that entitlement could still be expired (if block.timestamp > entitlement.expiry)

devdoc.title: HookMultiVault-implementation of a Vault for multiple assets within a NFT collection, with entitlements.

Approval(address,address,uint32).notice: Emitted when `beneficialOwner` enables `approved` to manage the `assetId` asset.

AssetFlashLoaned(address,uint256,address.notice: emitted after an asset is flash loaned by its beneficial owner.

AssetReceived(address,address,address,ui.notice: emitted when an asset is added into the vault

AssetWithdrawn(uint32,address,address).notice: emitted when an asset is withdrawn from the vault

BeneficialOwnerSet(uint32,address,addres.notice: emitted when the beneficial owner of an asset changes

EntitlementCleared(uint256,address).notice: emitted when an entitlement is cleared from an asset

EntitlementImposed(uint32,address,uint32.notice: emitted when an entitlement is placed on an asset

constructor.notice: Upgradeable Implementations cannot have a constructor, so we call the initialize instead;

getCurrentEntitlementOperator(uint32).notice: looks up the current operator of an entitlement on an asset

userdoc.notice: HookVault holds a multiple NFT asset in escrow on behalf of multiple beneficial owners. Other contracts are able to register "entitlements" for a fixed period of time on the asset, which give them the ability to change the vault's owner.
